event.title: 1771 after Paul Wentworth, the town was incorporated

data.event: Originally named Paulsburg in 1771 after Paul Wentworth, the town was incorporated on December 16, 1824.

event.title: that year, Governor Levi Woodbury authorized

data.event: In that year, Governor Levi Woodbury authorized a name change to Milan, in honor of Milan Harris.
In 1819 the population was about fourteen; ten years passed and the number had increased four-fold.
The soil was warmer, more free from frost, and, for some years, produced quite liberally in response to the labors of the pioneers.
